liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>HNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="negative 348" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>348</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> The table above provides the values for the standard enthalpy change for two chemical reactions. A student needs to calculate the enthalpy change for the reaction <math alttext="2 H N O 3 liquid reacts to produce N 2 O 5 gas plus H 2 O liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>HNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> under standard conditions using Hess’s law. In addition to the values given in the table, what other information will the student need to perform the calculation?

skill.text: 5.A: Identify quantities needed to solve a problem from given information (e.g., text, mathematical expressions, graphs, or tables).
